intro: Chabertia haussmanniana, commonly known as the Hausmann's chabertia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
